item.title: [PI] Killstreak counter (rewards coming soon)
item.dc:creator: @collin123456 collin123456
item.description:
@collin123456 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:4, topic:418997”] if (dead) { killstreak = 0; }

Is that not a vital part?

The killstreak would just act like pkpoints if you don’t have it reseting after every time they die…[/quote]

if your asking if that should be in there… it is, and it works fine resetting when you die

item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

if (dead) {
    killstreak = 0;
}

Is that not a vital part?

The killstreak would just act like pkpoints if you don’t have it reseting after every time they die…

item.title: [PI] Killstreak counter (rewards coming soon)
item.dc:creator: @collin123456 collin123456
item.description:
@collin123456 wrote:

i saw this for delta, so i made a simple version for PI as it’s commonly used, it works to keep track of kills in a row, if you have suggestions of rewards, tell me please.

MAKE A BACKUP IN CASE YOU ADD IT WRONG!

First we want to make it save it.
in player.java add this:

Now in playerSave.java you need to add:

} else if (token.equals("killStreak")) { p.killStreak = Integer.parseInt(token2);
you will also need to add this in PlayerSave.java:

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("killStreak = ", 0, 13); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.killStreak), 0, Integer.toString(p.killStreak).length());
now it should save properly!

This is when it gets harder, because it might not be the same for everybody.
in PlayerAssistant.java add this, which ends your killstreak when you die.

under

which is in “public void applyDead() {”
now we want to add it so it adds a kill to your streak everytime you kill somebody
Still in PlayerAssistant.java find:

o.pkPoints++; o.sendMessage("You have received a point, you now have "+o.pkPoints+" pk points."); } else { o.sendMessage("You have recently defeated "+c.playerName+", you don't receive any pk points."); }
and change that to:

o.pkPoints++; o.killStreak++; o.sendMessage("You have received a point, you now have "+o.pkPoints+" pk points."); } else { o.sendMessage("You have recently defeated "+c.playerName+", you don't receive any pk points."); }

and if you added it correctly it should keep track of kills in a row, if you have suggestions for rewards, tell me so i can add them to this.

i have fixed it so you can’t get rewards from killing the same person over and over

---------------------------------rewards-----------------------------
30 kills in a row (not finished, i got confused on it, if anybody wants to help, cool, if not, i will finish it later!)
i have this in PlayerAssistant.java

public void HandleKSR30 () { if (c.inWild() && (c.getPA().killstreak > 30)) { final int damage = Misc.random(90) + 10; c.startAnimation(12565); Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex].playerLevel[3] -= damage; c.sendMessage("You Activate your killstreak reward, dealing massive damage to your enemy!"); c.killStreak = 0; } else { c.sendMessage("You can't use this, you don't have enough kills!"); } }
and this in Commands.java

if (playerCommand.startsWith("ksr3")) { c.getPA().HandleKSR30(); }

deals large amount of damage to person they are fighting, still needs some stuff to work though

Credits:
youridudock: 90% for the idea
Me: 10% for making this

note: if you have any suggestions on how to make this a better tutorial on adding this please tell me
[size=14pt]I AM NOW LOOKING FOR A SOURCE TO FINISH THIS ON, SORRY[/size]

Read full topic
